1111.content:
One day, Jaune got a case that says something about students missing at a school. He decides to go with his partner, Ruby, to investigate the problem. However, as soon as they got their and got separated, Jaune stumbles into a strange building that was not in the school maps. Unfortunately, a bright light blinds Jaune and after several seconds, he finds himself in a strange forest. The trees were massive, even though they don't have branches, big boulders, and Jaune can hear giant creatures nearby. Unfortunately, that is the least of his problem when he felt the ground shaking. The shaking got stronger an stronger, like something is coming. And before Jaune knew it, a massive object came from the sky an almost slam on top of him. Jaune looks and sees that the object was a shoe, a mountain size shoe. He gulps in fear as he looks up and see that this shoe belongs to an even bigger girl. The redheaded girl is looking around until she spots something by her feet.
"Ohh, what's that?" Nora ask herself as she bends down. Jaune watches in fear as the massive hand...
1111.title: The adventure begins

11111.content:
Jaune watched in absolute fear as the giant orange haired girls hand descends closer to him. he can do nothing but accept it as the fingers wrap around him. Two fingers pushed into him, one at the front and one at the back. Jaune feels them push into him as he gets lifted off of the ground. He gets taken for a ride as the girl raises him up and up. Past her legs, past her skirt, past her torso and up to her face. More specifically her eye as she sees exactly what Jaune is.

For Jaune, it was absolutely terrifying to be completely powerless to this normal girl. And her eye scanning him over didn't help.

With looking so close it was only normal for Nora to recognise him as more then just a small bug.

“Wow, Your Like A Small Man!” She cheered as she brought him further away from her face. Her mouth wide open in amazement. “What Are You! You Have Got To Tell Me!”

Seeing a chance to turn a poor situation to a good one he decided to explain his situation. How he was a Detective and investigating the missing students. She looked like she was following however she wasn't.

 “I didn't really catch any of that” She said “Sorry about that little guy, i was just too obsessed with how cute you look” She then dropped him into her palm as she brought her giant finger closer. Attempting to pat him gently on the head, however it was more like a fatal blow to Jaune. “I mean at that size, you've got to be the greatest guy in the world. Every girl would probably fall for you without you even trying”

Jaune fought off her finger as he looked at her. “Well, i don't want to be this size” He said to her. “My partner Ruby would probably be around here. If you and find her she can help me”

“Sorry Little Guy. But I've got my own things to do” She said dismissing him “Oh i know you can come with me!”

Jaune face palmed himself. Did this girl not hear that he had a job to do. She seems to be impossible to get through to.

“I don't have time to come with you, can you just t-”

“Oh don't be a Bossy Bradley” She said as She just dismissed his wishes. “You’ll love it with me, ill show you around the school and all the cooler girls around. Oh and i can even feed you some food and teach you tricks.”

The first part sounded helpful to Jaune. The second part didn't. “Anyway, I've got to move. And I've got to introduce you to _________________”

Find Ruby and get her attention

The Goliath hand reaches behind Juan. He turns around and see that the giant girl is picking up a badge that he was wearing that tells people he is an inspector. The world rumbles as Nora stands back up with the badge in hands.

"Oooohhh, a shiny badge, i can play detective. I want to show this to Pyra." The peppy red head says as she lifts her foot. Jaun watch from the ground as the massive shoe hovers above him and lands miles behind him in just a single step. This happens many times as Nora leaves the tiny Juan.

"I need to get help.... somehow...." Juan said to himself as he gets up. Remembering just how huge Nora is to him, its safe to say that everyone normal size will be as gigantic to him. With that in mind, Juan quickly tries to leave the area before something bad could happen to him. Weighing his options, Juan decide to get....

Jaun knows that he needs to get someone's attention, anyone's attention. Being shrunk is a big problem and defiantly will make it harder for him to solve the case. Not only that but Ruby is probably far away from Jaun so he can't get her help. Jaun debated on following and getting the orange haired girls help but decides against. She seemed as bubbly as his partner. He needs to find some mature, proper and-"

"Absolutely Beautiful" Jaun said adding that last part as he saw the girl that walked into the hallway. She had white hair that tied up into a ponytail and despite her petite figure she held a mature aura around her. Jaun just knew he had to get her help.

Jaun ran all the way towards the girls locker where she stopped. The Bag she was carrying was also on the ground, this let Jaun know exactly what he was going to do. He would climb into the bag and hitch a ride with her. Then when either she's easily available or he spots his partner Ruby. He would sneak out.

Jaun climbed into the bug using all his upper body strength (As limited as it may be) and pulled himself to the top. He then fell straight down into the bag as she grabbed it and brought it up into the air. She then started to walk towards her next class.

Jaun could feel every move and every strut that the white haired girl did. Jaun was being thrown around her entire bag. Suddenly there was a big hit and Jaun could feel the bag hit the ground and all of the stuff as well as Jaun slides out of the bag. Jaun looks up and sees what happened.

"Watch where your going" the white girl said to the other girl she bumped into. Questions who is it?

1111211.content:
Jaune could not believe his luck, the first person this girl bump into and it was his partner, Ruby.

"Oops, sorry, wasn't paying attention." Ruby's voice echo above as she talks to the white hair girl. Jaune was about to shout out to Ruby when the world shakes as both girls gst on their knees to pick up the stuff. "Here let me help you."

"Fine but hurry up, I'm about to be late." The girl says as she waste little time in grabbing her stuff.

Jaune tries to shout to eithet of the girls, but soon massive hands came down and almost smack into him. Jaune was i little bit in a bad spot as the girls were too busy to notice a speck on the ground. Jaune avoids the massive hands that are ready to crush him while the titan size girls above were having a question.

"If its not too much trouble, can you answer some question for me?" Ruby ask.

"As long their quick." The girl says as she already pick up halve of her school stuff.

"Supposedly there are missing students, do you anything about it?"

"Other then that they all appeared to be boys, no. As much as this school allows both genders, we pretty much stay on one side until special events happens that allows to both to interact. So anything that happens at the boys side tend to stay at their side." The girl says.

"Weird system to have, don't you think?" Ruby says as she and the girl is almost done.

"I didn't made the rules, ask Principal Goodwitch about it." The girl zays as she picks up one last item and stood up. "OK, if that's all, i got to go."

"Sure, huh, oh you forgot your dust cylinder." Ruby says as she points at a blue dust fill canister. Little does the girl knows, when they were talking, one of them knock Jaune on top of the cylinder.
1111211.title: Giant Rose Ahead

choices: Ruby Is Worried. She acts professional
Ruby Is Ruby. She acts immaturely
11112111.content:
Ruby starts grabbing all the stuff that fell out of the bag, she sees a cylinder on the ground, it was filled with weird contents. "Uh What's in there" ruby says asking the white haired girl trying to get context. "Why do you care?" the white girl replied a little snobby. "if you must know. My name is Weiss Schnee and I'm the heiress to the Schnee family. In there is a private subject only the Schnee family needs to knows" "Okay Fine" Ruby asked backing off.

As Ruby went to grab the cylinder she saw a little bug. At first Ruby was going to ignore it. Until it started to look like it was jumping up and down. It also wasn't shaped like a bug, more like a human. "No Way." Ruby stated in shock as she realized who it was, it was Jaune! "Well, hurry up and pick it up" Weiss commanded "Uh I got to go real quick. Sorry" Ruby said as she gently plucked Jaune from around the cylinder. "Hey" Weiss called. "Where do you think your going.

Ruby ran inside of a empty classroom, while carrying Jaune in a safety grip, not to hard so he would be strangled but no to soft that he would fall. Once inside Ruby gentle dropped Jaune on one of the students desk. Once Jaune hit the table ruby sat down right in front of him. "Jaune?"

After being released from his partners grasp, Jaune noticed he was in a classroom and his partner was sitting at the desk. Staring down at him, while Jaune stared up at her. Seeing Ruby, his friend who usually is so much smaller than him, being so close and so intimidating. "Jaune? Ruby asked still barely believing it "Yep Ruby, it's me"

What is Ruby's reaction to this?
11112111.title: Ruby Sees Jaune

choices: Investigate the place where Jaune shrunk.
111121111.content:
"What happened?" Ruby asked, concern in her voice. "How did you get so small?"

"Well you see, that's the thing. I don't know." Jaune answered.

"Hmm, what do you remember?" Ruby questioned.

"Well..."

Jaune then explained everything that had happened so far, from entering the school, finding a building that wasn't on the map, getting blinded by a flash of light, waking up the size of a bug, nearly getting stepped on by a girl and finding Weiss and then Ruby.

Ruby, surprisingly, wrote all of this down in a notebook. It seemed that she had dropped her childish tendencies and was actually taking this seriously.

"Okay, I think I got everything." she said, putting her notebook and pen away.

"You're... acting surprisingly professional." Jaune remarked.

"Well of course!" Ruby replied. "We need to get you back to your normal size! And we need to solve this case!"

Ruby then reached down and ever-so-gently grasped Jaune between her fingers, lifting him into the air. She didn't want to tell Jaune, but it was actually taking every ounce of her self control to not act childish at this moment, especially since she was literally holding a tiny person with just her fingers.

"Okay, what do you think we should do?" Ruby asked.

"Well..." Jaune thought for a moment before coming to a decision. "I think we should..."
111121111.title: Ruby acts... mature?

"We're going to talk to Goodwitch and see if she knows something."
"We're going to find the orange hair girl that has your badge."
111121112.content:
"Oh my god, you look so adorable at this size." Ruby says as she moves one of her hands to "gently" rub Jaune. Jaune saw the building size finger and try to run. Unfortantly for him, he was too small to run. Ruby's finger practically dwarf him as it pin him down.

"Ruby! Now is not the...!" Jaune struggles to say anything to make Ruby to take the situation seriously, but to no avail.

"When i saw you, i thought you were a bug. I wonder where you went after we split. What happened, did you find a shrink ray, a portal that took you to a different dimension? Ohh, maybe you ate a cookie that alters your size like that one story." Ruby says as she continues to think of possibilities while still rubbing Jaune's tiny body.

"Keep crushing me, and you might not find out." Jaune says as he tries to crawl out from beneath the fingertip. After Ruby finally lift her finger, Jaune explains what happened shortly after they split.

"So other then you blacking out in the school ground, nothing happened at all?" Ruby says.

"Well, other than a orange hair girl taking my badge after i shrunk to this size, no." Jaune say. "And you?"

"Well i found this cute doggy, but nothing that stood out to be honest. Only other thing i can think of is asking the principal... Goodwitch i think Weiss said, see if she knows anything." Ruby says.

"Well, either way, I'm kind of stuck like this until we can find a way to reverse it." Jaune says.

"Oh it can't be all that bad." Ruby says, trying to cheer her partner up.

"Ruby, I almost got step on, had to climb girls whose everyday objects are either buildings or mountains to me, and while smaller than a flea." Jaune states.

"Good point." Ruby says as she stands up. She gently picks up Jaune from the table. "Until we find a way to grow you back, you can stay in my pocket." Ruby says as she was about to lower Jaune to one of her pockets that is on her skirt.

"Wait, before you do that, do you at least know where you plan on going?" Jaune says as he wants to make sure Ruby was heading to a good start, considering his life is laterally in her hands.

"Of course...." Ruby says.
111121112.title: Ruby Is Ruby. She acts immaturely

choices: Bust In and see what's up
1111211121.content:
"We're going to the place you shrunk to see if we can spot anything that might have done this" Ruby said cheerily as she deposits Jaune into her skirt. Jaune fell down the fibers as he slid to the bottom of the pocket. Jaune went to proper himself when all of a sudden he felt a giant force push him into the side where Ruby's leg is. Then it stopped and then it was again, this repeated several times as Ruby was patting the pocket from above.

"Don't worry Jaune, we will figure out why you got so small. And if not don't worry, it won't be so bad being small just I,aging the giant cookies" Ruby said from above. Jaune didn't know what was worse, Being this small or Ruby's lack of care and childlike innocence. After this is over Jaune's thinking about commissioning for a new Partner. One less Ruby like.

When Ruby finally arrived at the strange Building she was more than cautious. She carefully tiptoes towards the door and proceeded to open it. However her stealth mission got interrupted when she heard a voice behind her.

"Excuse me, who are you!" a snarky voice behind says. Ruby quickly turns around. There she sees a girl with green hair and dark skin. She had her arms crossed over her breasts and a not impressed look.

"Ruby breathed a sigh of relief. Something about that girl just felt wrong to Ruby. Once she's out of sight Ruby went to open the door. However she is stopped when the door refused to open up. As it was locked.

"Gosh darn it" Ruby says as her plan was holted. She could break in but it would look bad towards the school board and that Goodwitch scares her beyond belief. Then again she could follow that girl, she seemed suspicious and might know something
1111211121.title: Detective Ruby

choices: Ruby saves him. It’s not like the ‘bug’ did anything wrong.
Weiss steps on him, but he miraculously survives. She presumes him dead.
Weiss steps on him and he dies, crushed completely under her shoe.
11112112.content:
Weiss sighed as she reached for the last dust cylinder on the floor. At first, she didn’t see Jaune standing on top of it, but as the blond jumped up and down, waving his arms, this changed. Judging by Weiss’ face, she was startled by Jaune’s presence, but that quickly turned to disgust.

‘Why do I suddenly feel like getting her attention was a bad idea?’ he asked himself.

“Ew!” Weiss cried. “A bug! In this school!”

Weiss glared in disgust and disbelief before reluctantly reaching down, grabbing the cylinder by the sides and gently shaking it, hoping to get the ‘bug’ off. As she shook it, Jaune held on for dear life.

“Hold on, I’m not a bug!” he yelled, his voice not reaching the student’s ears. “I’m a person!”

Seeing the tiny creature still holding on, Weiss began shaking the cylinder more violently. Jaune’s grip finally gave out and he was flung across the hall, landing hard and painfully on the floor. From his perspective, he flew at least 40 feet, but in reality, he barely flew a couple metres.

Groaning as he looked up towards the ceiling, his body aching tremendously from being thrown like a rag doll, he saw the white-haired girl making her way over to him. As he stood up and attempted to run, he soon realised that wasn’t an option as he toppled over, not having recovered from the fall yet.

‘Oh god, this isn’t gonna end well for me, is it?’ he thought.

He looked to be correct as Weiss literally towered over him. She was just an average girl, but to him, she was as tall as the tallest building, perhaps even taller. Then, with a satisfied smile, she raised her foot into the air. He watched with absolute horror as the bottom of her shoe descended upon him, with the girl intending to crush him and end his life completely.

As Jaune braced for impact...
11112112.title: Weiss mistakes Jaune for a bug.

choices: Weiss made it to her class
Weiss was once again stop by someone
Jaune somehow got dislodged from the gum
111121122.content:
Jaune close his eyes as the massive shoe descended at great speed towards him. At first, a loud explosive noise hits Jaune's ears, then Jaune soon sees nothing. However, Jaune was expecting to feel some kind of great pain or something, in fact, all he felt was stickiness. Before Jaune could why he's still alive, the building that is Weiss's shoe is moving again...with Jaune stuck to it. As the shoe lifts up, Jaune could look at the ground that he was standing on seconds ago and can see the cayon size foot print that he should paste in. He then look around and saw that he was covered in gum that is at the bottom of Weiss's shoe.

"Ha, got the bug." Weiss's voice could be heard above as the shoe descend with Jaune attach. Jaune cover his eyes as ground came to him at great speed, yet he still lives. Somehow being stuck to the gum is protecting Jaune from getting crush, but it also means he's stuck.

"Kind of overreacting don't you think?" Ruby says as she watched Weiss stomp the ground.

"Hey, I don't like bugs okay. Now if you're done asking question, I got to get going." Weiss says as she proceed to walk away before Ruby could say anything. Ruby just sigh and shrugs as she goes somewhere else to finds clues.

Meanwhile, Jaune is not exactly having the best experience. Each time Weiss takes a step, it feels like a nonstop rollercoaster that is too much to handle. Jaune feels like he's closer of getting crush if Weiss doesn't stop soon. It only feels worse as Weiss pick up her speed to make it to her class. As Jaune struggle to keep his lunch...
111121122.title: Save by gum luck

choices: She happened to look down and see him on the floor.
She stepped over him and walked away.
1111211222.content:
As Weiss was walking to her next class, Jaune kept trying to force himself free from the gum that trapped him to bottom of her shoe. But between the gum being so sticky and each of the giant girl's footsteps feeling like a car landed on top of him, he couldn't find a proper time to make his escape. Not to mention that the nonstop movement was triggering his motion sickness. He remembered his first ride on a rollercoaster (which also happened to be his last) and realised that this was at least ten times worse than that. He was starting to believe that volunteering to investigate this case was the biggest mistake of his life, since it's what brought him to this moment. He could feel himself about to faint.

"Hey, Weiss! How's it going?" A girl's voice called out to Weiss.

She suddenly came to a stop, Jaune finally getting a much-deserved break from the motion and having a chance to catch his breath. Of course, with the bottom of Weiss' shoe now on the floor, he couldn't see anything.

"Oh, for the love of..." Jaune heard Weiss mutter under her breath before she responded to the other person. "It's going great, Yang. Thanks for asking. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to get to class."

"Wow, that's cold, even for you, Weiss!" the girl named Yang joked with the most cheerful voice Jaune had ever heard. "I just wanted to know if you'd like to go with-"

"No, I don't," Weiss interrupted.

"Oh come on! You didn't even let me finish!" Yang whinged.

"I don't need to, I know it's something I won't be interested in," Weiss said. "Now, I need to get going. I have about a minute to get to class, so I can't stand around talking to you any longer."

"Okay, how about this? You listen to my question real quick and I'll let you go," Yang bargained.

"Ugh, there's just no winning with you sometimes..." Weiss groaned. "Fine, make it quick. And when I say quick, I mean quick."

Weiss subconsciously began tapping her foot on the ground, something she often found herself doing whenever she was getting impatient. For her, it was just a small, insignificant movement, one that most people wouldn't take any notice of.

For Jaune though, it was hell. His body was aching more and more as it was slammed into the floor repeatedly. Weiss had no idea how much she was tormenting the poor boy with just a simple movement. She had no idea that with each tap of her foot on the floor, she threatened to crush Jaune's tiny body.

"Alright, I will! Jeez..." Yang muttered before continuing. "As I was saying, I just wanted to know if you'd like to go with me and a few friends to a dance club this Friday night? You know, take a load off, relax, enjoy ourselves, have a great time! You in?"

Jaune was starting to see stars at this point. Luckily for him though, Weiss finally stopped tapping her foot. The heel of her shoe was still on the floor, but the front of her shoe, where Jaune was trapped in the gum, was now hovering no more than an inch above.

'She's... stopped...' Jaune thought, struggling not to let exhaustion overcome him. 'Alright, it's now or never!'

Jaune used what little strength he had left to try to pull himself free of the gum. At first, it seemed like no progress was being made until he finally felt the sticky grip on one of his arms loosen before he managed to break free from it.

"Alright!" Jaune yelled out, finally feeling a little bit of relief and hope.

"Yang, I would've expected you to know by now...." Weiss began replying to Yang.

"Come on! Come... on!" Jaune exclaimed as he pulled his other arm free.

"...that out of every single person you know..." Weiss continued.

"I will... get free!" Jaune declared as, bit by bit, he freed himself a little more.

"...I would be the very last person to accept that invitation," Weiss finished.

"Just one more pull..." Jaune said as he saw victory ahead of him.

As Jaune gave one final pull, he let out a fierce yell to psyche himself up, like a warrior unleashing a battle cry before delivering a powerful strike to their opponent. His hope and resolve paid off as he finally freed himself from the gum, falling to the floor. The hard landing left him short of breath, but he would much rather feel this pain and exhaustion than continue feeling that motion sickness.

"Now, I'm not going to let you waste any more of my time," Weiss stated, her patience well beyond its limit. "Goodbye, Yang."

As Weiss was about to walk away, Jaune, realising he still wasn't in the clear yet, somehow found more strength in his body. Using this last bit of strength that he couldn't believe he had, he rolled out of the way as Weiss' giant shoe slammed down on the ground right next to him. He looked up and watched as the giant white-haired girl continued walking away.

"I'd like to go home now..." he muttered out loud.

Yang also watched Weiss walk away until she disappeared around a corner. She then sighed with a look of exasperation on her face.

"She seems like she's in an even crabbier mood than usual," she muttered to herself, "and that's saying a lot."

Jaune looked up at the girl towering above him, realising that this was Yang. She had blond hair, eyes with a light purple colour and a noticeably attractive figure. If the situation were less dire, he would've allowed his eyes to wander, but right now, he had more important things on his mind. He weakly tried calling up to the girl.

"Hey... down here..."

The strain that his body had been put through in the last few minutes had taken a big toll on him. He couldn't even raise his voice above normal speaking level, let alone shout.

"Please... look down here... on the floor..."

"Well, better get to class before I get in trouble," Yang mumbled to herself.

As she took a step in Jaune's direction...
1111211222.title: Weiss was once again stopped by someone

choices: Reached down and picked him up to take a closer look at him.
Laughed at how crazy the idea was. "Bug-sized people? There's no such thing!"
11112112221.content:
Jaune watched in horror as Yang took a step towards him. He couldn't move his body, he couldn't scream to her, he couldn't do anything to avoid being crushed by her giant shoe. He closed his eyes and surrendered to his fate, when he heard it. A loud crash, the familiar sound of a giant footstep. He opened his eyes, preparing for the worst, but instead was met with something surprising.

The giant girl known as Yang was staring down at the floor... directly at Jaune.

"Woah..." she uttered with a bewildered look on her face. "That bug kinda looks like a tiny person."

"Y-yes... that's what I am..." Jaune weakly answered. "I'm a person..."

Having recovered just a little bit of his strength, he managed to move one of his arms back and forth in an attempt to show her that she was right.

"Wait, did it just wave at me?" Yang questioned. "Or am I just seeing things?"

"No, you're not... I'm real..." Jaune replied again as loud as he could manage in this state of exhaustion as he continued waving his arm.

"I don't know why, but I feel like it can understand me... like it's trying to communicate with me... almost like it actually is a tiny person..."

Yang continued to stare in astonishment at Jaune, who kept waving, trying to keep her attention.

"My arm's getting tired... Please, just see me... You have to see what I am by now..."

Yang stared down at him for a few seconds longer, deep in thought, until she...
11112112221.title: The Giant Blonde Spots the Tiny Blonde

choices: "Can you please take me back to where I was shrunk?"
"Can you please take me to the headmistress?"
"Can you please help me find my partner?"
111121122211.content:
Yang, an amazed expression still on her face, knelt down and reached her hand out to the tiny Jaune, causing him to flinch. Her fingers grasped him and he was lifted up off the floor. He was displayed in front of the giant, curious eyes of Yang. She stared at him for what felt like an eternity before breaking the silence.

"Are... are you real?" She asked.

"Yeah... I am..." Jaune managed to answer, barely able to raise his voice.

"Woah... You really are a tiny person... But that's impossible, there's no way you can-"

She stopped talking as she heard the sound of footsteps coming down the hall.

"Oh crap!" She whispered. "Sorry, we can't talk right now! I need to hide!"

"Wait, wha-?"

Jaune couldn't even finish his sentence before Yang stuffed him into her shirt, wedging him between her boobs, which at his size were like large hills to him. Normally he would've been embarrassed, but due to exhaustion and the movement catching him off-guard, he didn't even have a chance to process what just happened.

Upon placing the bug-boy in her shirt, Yang immediately took off, running down the halls of the school. She made several turns, each one making Jaune feel worse and worse as he struggled to contain the contents of his stomach, his motion sickness at an all-time high.

"Please, slow down..." he futilely begged, his voice not reaching her ears.

--- A short while later... (Though it definitely didn't feel like a short while to Jaune...) ---

Yang breathed a sigh of relief as she sat down. Currently, she was in a part of the school that usually nobody came to, at least not at this time of day. Whenever she felt like skipping a class, this was where she came. Teachers almost never checked here, and even if they did, she knew a good hiding spot to avoid them. This was her perfect place for some R&R.

However, now wasn't the time to sit back and relax. She reached into her shirt and pulled out the tiny Jaune, who was on the verge of passing out.

"Sorry about that, little guy," she apologised. "I'm supposed to be in class right now, so I couldn't afford to be seen by the teacher. Are you okay?"

Jaune could only pant. This day had been so cruel to him. His body, mind and soul were reaching their limits.

"I guess that ride was a bit too much for you..." she said.

She was smiling, but it was mostly a guilty smile with a dash of sympathy.

"It's okay, you just rest for a bit, alright?" She assured him. "I'll talk to you when you're ready."

Jaune continued to pant, as well as clutch his stomach, trying not to throw up. He was like this for several minutes before his stomach finally seemed to calm down and he managed to get some of his breath back.

"Okay, I think... I'm good now..." he mumbled before looking up to the giant girl, calling out to her. "Hello?"

"Uh, hello…" Yang replied awkwardly. "So, uh, what exactly are you? You look like a human and you can even speak, but you're bug-sized."

"Actually, I am human."

"What? But that's impossible! No human is that small!"

"I wasn't born like this. I was shrunk."

"Shrunk?"

"Yeah. You see, I'm a detective and my partner and I came here to investigate the disappearing students…"

One somewhat long explanation later...

"...Wow, you've had quite the day, huh?" Yang said, not knowing how else to reply.

"Yeah, you could say that..." Jaune replied exhaustedly. "Listen, I need your help. Getting around the school is almost impossible for me. It takes me so long to travel across one hallway, not to mention that it's dangerous. I already got stomped on and only survived because of luck. I don't want to take that chance again. Next time, I might end up actually being crushed."

"You want my help?" Yang asked before putting her hand on her chin in thought. "Hmm… Should I, though? It sounds like a lotta work…"

"Please! I can't continue the investigation on my own!"

"Relax, little buddy, I was just joking!" Yang assured with a chuckle. "Of course I'll help."

"Really? Thank you so much! If I can get through this, I'll find a way to repay you, I swear!"

1111211223133232.content:
Jaune wanted to move, he wanted to dodge, he wanted to run. However. his legs were shaking uncontrollably. His fear took over his body, causing his fight or flight senses to completely shut down. However, as the shoe was about crush him...

"Wait!"

Jaune heard Ruby's voice exclaim, before her giant hand grabbed the shoe, preventing it from descending any further. Jaune had been saved... for now.

"W-woah!" The giant blonde exclaimed as she recoiled out of surprise, nearly falling over as she lost her balance. "What's the big idea?"

Ruby didn't answer her as she reached down and gently grasped Jaune in her fingers before lifting him up to meet her gaze. She could see the look of anxiety on his face.

"Uh... hi, Ruby..." he greeted, giving an awkward wave.

"Oh my god, Jaune! It is you!" She realised. "What happened? How'd you get so small? Are you okay?"

"Ruby, calm down!" Jaune replied, overwhelmed by the sudden bombardment of questions. "Yes, I'm okay... barely."

"Wait, what's going on?" The blond asked, confused. "Why are you talking to the bug?"

"Yang, this isn't a bug," Ruby explained. "This is my partner, Jaune. Jaune, this is Yang, one of the students here."

Ruby held Jaune in front of Yang's eyes, allowing her to see him better. Her face went from confused to shocked.

"Woah, he's so small!" She said in wonder. "How did you get so small? That's so... so..."

Her eyes then widened in horror as she realised what she had done. She thought she was about to squash a mere bug, but she was actually about squash the shrunken Jaune!

"Oh my god, I almost crushed you!" She said. "I didn't know you were a person! I thought you were a bug! Oh god, I'm so, so sorry!"

Jaune was still in shock over that whole situation, but he could tell by the look on Yang's face that she felt legitimately guilty.

"H-hey, it's okay!" Jaune reassured. "It's all sorted now! I'm still alive, so everything's okay! Anyways, nice to meet you!"

Yang faintly smiled, happy that Jaune found it in himself to forgive her.

"Nice to meet you, too," she replied. "And I'm glad you're okay, but still, I promise I'll find a way to make it up to you."

"Alright, I'll hold you to that promise," Jaune joked.

Ruby smiled at the scene.

'At least things are going a bit more smoothly now,' she thought.

"Anyways, back to business," Ruby said as she held Jaune back in front of her own face. "Tell me everything that you know."

Jaune was surprised at how mature ruby was acting, though this was definitely a pleasant surprise.

The shrunken boy then told his giant partner everything he remembered, from waking up shrunken, to the ordeals he's had to go through, to finally reuniting with her. In exchange, Ruby told Jaune everything that she'd managed to gather, from the disappearing students being boys, to the mysterious woman that Yang had seen roaming the school.

"You think maybe that woman has something to do with the disappearances?" Jaune inquired.

"She could have," Yang said. "But I think Cinder, Emerald and Neo are definitely up to something."

"Then that just leaves us with one question..." Ruby realised.

"Where do we go first?"

“Well let’s see how you like it. Come here bug, there’s a girl that wants you!” She said, getting down onto her knee and reaching for Jaune.

After weighing his options, Jaune decided to forget about the badge, seeing as he would have to take it from a giant girl. He turned around and walked away, continuing his search of the school.

"Huh?" Ruby uttered, before realising what the girl meant. "Oh, no, I'm not a student here! I'm one of the detectives investigating the disappearances of the students."

"You're a detective? You look a bit young."

"I see..." the girl said, clearly somewhat sceptical. "Anyway, can I help you?"

"Yeah, I was wondering if you could answer a few questions for me."

"Sure, I've got a few minutes to spare."

'Hmm, trying to get their attention from the ground would be too difficult...' Jaune thought, before shuddering. '...Not to mention, I don't want them to mistake me for a bug like that Weiss girl did... Maybe I could climb up her body to her ear and yell into it. That should get her attention. Then again... that is a really big climb...'

Jaune stood there, weighing his options. Eventually, he decided to...
1111211223331.title: Enter Velvet

111121123.content:
Weiss’ shoe continued lowering, getting closer and closer to the ground, and by extension, Jaune. He watched with complete fear as he awaited his demise.

The bottom of the girl’s shoe hit him with incredible force, causing him great pain. He felt his breath get knocked out of his body and his vision became very blurry and dark.

He was too miserable to be relieved when he felt the weight lift from him. Weiss lifted her foot and crouched down, pulling out a tissue from her pocket to wipe up the ‘bug’ she had just stepped on. To her surprise however, it twitched, showing it was still alive. Scoffing, she stood back up and once again lifted her shoe above it.

Jaune, still not recovered from the first stomp, was too exhausted to move. In fact, he was too exhausted to even scream.

Once again, Weiss lowered her foot on top of him, this time with much more force. As she stomped on him, she began twisting her foot, grinding his tiny body into the floor with her shoe.

Once she was sure he was dead, she lifted her foot to reveal a tiny bloodstain. Now satisfied with her work, she crouched down and used the tissue to wipe up the stain left behind. She then lifted her shoe up and wiped the bottom of it to remove whatever might’ve been stuck to it.

Ruby watched with disbelief.

“You didn’t need to do that!” she said. “The bug wasn’t hurting anyone!”

“It’s unsanitary.” Weiss replied apathetically. “Besides, it’s just a bug. It was gonna get squashed eventually.”

She then walked away, throwing the tissue in a nearby bin as she left, leaving Ruby to look down at the floor where the ‘bug’ used to be. Realising she had other important things to do though, like finding Jaune, she began walking down the hall in the opposite direction.

Neither of them ever found out that the ‘bug’ that Weiss squashed without a care in her world was actually a tiny Jaune.

Ruby never solved the case of the missing students at the school. When she returned to the agency, reported Jaune as missing. All she could do from then on was hope that either he would return or someone would find him.

As Ruby picked up the Dust cylinder, Weiss looked at a clock on the wall and saw it was almost time for her next class to begin.

"Oh shoot, I have to get going!" She started speed-walking away.

"Hey, you forgot this!" Ruby said, waving the cylinder around.

"RUBY, STOP!" Jaune yelled as he barely managed to hold onto the cylinder with his giant partner waving it around.

"Keep it, I can't afford to be late to class by even a second!" Weiss called back, not turning around.

She disappeared around the corner, leaving Ruby standing there, confused as to what to do next.

"Hmm, I guess I should start looking for Jaune again." She said aloud.

"RUBY, I'M HERE!" Jaune yelled at the top of his lungs, hoping she would hear him. "I'M HERE, ON THE DUST CYLINDER!"

As Ruby began walking, she put the cylinder into her pocket, Jaune still clinging onto it and dropping into her pocket with it.

'Damnit!' he thought. 'Now how am I supposed to get her attention?

He started thinking of some ideas. Obviously he needed to get out of her pocket, but how?

Maybe he could climb out of her pocket. But if he did, what would he do afterwards? Maybe he could climb up her body and try to reach her ear where he could yell to get her attention? Or maybe he could try climbing across her skirt to the other pocket where her scroll was and somehow use that?

Or perhaps instead of climbing anywhere, he could stay in her pocket and wait to see what happens?

'Hmm, I guess I'll...'
111121131.title: Ruby picks up the Dust cylinder.

1111211311.content:
Jaune came to a decision. Waiting in Ruby's pocket wouldn't yield any results and even if he climbed over to her other pocket, her scroll would probably be too big for him to do anything with it. His only hope was to climb up to her ear and yell into it. Surely, she would hear him then... right?

He began his climb, making his way up the inside of the pocket. As he finally exited through the opening, he looked up, immediately realising this would be quite the task. Ruby wasn't a tall girl at all, but from Jaune's perspective, she was the size of a building, maybe even a mountain.

'Aw man, maybe this was a bad idea...' Jaune thought. 'Maybe I should just go back in her pocket and wait after all.' He then shook his head. 'No, that won't work. I need to get her attention as soon as possible.'

With that in mind, Jaune continued climbing. He left Ruby's skirt behind and made his way up her stomach. He heard a loud grumbling noise and felt a large vibration.

"Man, I really need some food right now..." Ruby complained.

'Now that she mentions it, I could go for some grub too...' Jaune thought.

However, he stayed focused on his current goal. He continued up to Ruby's chest, keeping a tight grip to her breasts as he climbed, his fear of falling growing more and more as he climbed higher. Ruby's breasts were usually pretty average. Not too small, but nothing special either. However, at Jaune's current size, they were definitely huge to him; big enough to provide him with a decent foothold as soon as he got on top of them, allowing him to feel slightly more relaxed and less anxious about falling. However, this was also where he realised his situation...

'I'm literally climbing on Ruby's boobs right now...'

Jaune began blushing intensely. This situation was definitely an embarrassing one for him, that's for sure. However, he quickly shook those thoughts out of his head, reminding himself that he was only doing this out of necessity. He continued climbing and finally reached Ruby's collarbone, a much less embarrassing part of her body for him to be climbing. He then diverted his course sideways, making his way to her shoulder.

Jaune sat down and sighed with relief as he finally reached his destination. He needed a breather and he definitely earned it.

'I'm safe... for now...' he thought. 'Now, to do what I climbed all the way up here to do...'

Jaune stood up and got as close as he could to Ruby's ear before yelling towards it.

"HEY! RUBY!"

Ruby stopped as she heard the sound of her blond partner yelling.

"Huh? Jaune?" she said, looking around. "Is that you?"

"YEAH! DOWN HERE!" Jaune replied.

"Huh? Down where?" Ruby asked, continuing to look around in confusion.

"DOWN HERE! ON YOUR SHOULDER!"

She raised a brow.

"My shoulder?" she asked before looking down at it.

At first, Ruby's brain didn't fully register Jaune's tiny presence. However, after staring at him for a while, her eyes widened in shock. She quickly reached up and grabbed him between her fingers.

"Woah, be careful!" Jaune exclaimed, surprised by the sudden motion.

Ruby held her tiny partner in front of her eyes.

"J-Jaune?" she stammered, not quite believing that what she was seeing was true.

"Yeah, it's me..." Jaune said nervously, waiting to see what would happen next.

"Is it really you?"

"Yeah, it is..."

"Oh my god..."
1111211311.title: Climbing up Ruby's body

111123.content:
Jaune decided that the best move would be to find Ruby and get her attention. Even if she couldn’t help him get back to his normal size, he could at least rely on her to keep him safe.

While Jaune wandered around, he made sure to look out for even the slightest sign of danger. At his size, nearly everything was a hazard, a threat to his very life. If he encountered an actual bug, it could kill him. If anyone was walking by and didn’t see him, they could accidentally step on him. Even if they did see him, they would likely mistake him for a bug. And not everyone likes bugs.

As he was walking, he felt a tremor. It was small but noticeable. However the next one was bigger. And the next one was bigger yet. As each tremor became bigger and bigger, Jaune soon found that one of his fears wasn’t far off. He gazed ahead and saw two giant shoes walking towards him. When he looked up, part of him was happy with what he saw, but most of him was terrified.

It was his partner, Ruby.

“HEY!” Jaune called out, his hands cupped over his mouth as a makeshift megaphone. “RUBY! DOWN HERE!”

However, she took no notice as she continued walking, her giant shoes getting dangerously close now.

“RUBY! LOOK AT THE GROUND! IT’S ME, JAUNE!”

Once again, Ruby’s ears failed to pick up the tiny voice of the tiny Jaune. Her footsteps became louder as she approached. Jaune looked up in horror as Ruby moved her foot forward to take another step.

‘This is it...’ Jaune thought sadly. ‘This is how I die...’

Jaune reflected on his short life as he prepared to face death via the bottom of his partner’s shoe. The same death many bugs face.

However, it seemed fate decided to spare him for now. Rather than landing directly on top of Jaune and crushing him like he was expecting, Ruby’s huge shoe crashed down a short distance in front of him, missing him. He then let out a breath he didn’t know he was holding as he looked up, seeing his friend, looming above him like a skyscraper. No, even taller than that.

‘Hmm, Jaune said he’d meet me here about twenty minutes ago. Where is he?’ Ruby wondered. ‘Even he’s not usually this late.’

As the girl looked around, Jaune straightened up.

‘Nows my chance!’ he thought with a slight amount of hope. He once again cupped his hands over his mouth and screamed at the top of his lungs.

“RUBY!”

This time, he seemed to be successful. Ruby perked up and her silver eyes scanned the area. However, she didn’t see anything, which was only natural, since the blond was a speck on the ground.

“Huh, weird.” Ruby said aloud to herself. “I could’ve sworn I heard Jaune’s voice.”

Jaune repeated the process, shouting as loud as he possibly could in a desperate attempt to get his dark-haired partner to notice him.

“YOU DID! I’M DOWN HERE ON THE GROUND!”

“Huh?” Ruby uttered, confused. “The ground?”

Jaune felt an immeasurable amount of relief when Ruby looked down at the ground where he was standing. That is, until a thought crossed his mind.

‘What if she doesn’t see me?’

As Ruby conintued to look at his spot, he waited for the moment of truth.

The truth was that...
111123.title: Find Ruby and get her attention

"DOWN HERE!" he screamed again.

If he were at his normal size, people would've thought he was a madman. But of course, this wasn't the case. He wasn't at his normal size, he was the size of a bug. He wasn't a madman.

He was desperate to survive.

Jaune's eyes widened with hope as he saw what he'd been waiting for. Ruby crouched down to take a closer look at what she'd seen on the ground. This time, her eyes widened as she realised that the creature on the ground that looked like a bug was actually something else entirely. It was a person.

111123231.content:
Ruby looked towards the entrance of the room. She saw a teacher with light blonde hair and green eyes behind glasses. This was the principal of the school, Glynda Goodwitch.

"Uh yeah, that's me." Ruby answered. "You must be Professor Goodwitch."

"That's right. I'm the principal of the school. Have a seat."

Jaune sighed in relief, knowing that he would have more time. He continued climbing as Ruby and Professor Goodwitch both sat down at the desk.

"So, you know why I called you here, right?" The principal asked the female detective.

"Yeah, cos of the missing students." Ruby answered. "You said that all of them are boys."

"That's right. No girls have disappeared yet. Only boys. Do you have any possible theories as to why?"

"No, I don't. Sorry."

"That's okay. By the way, I remember being told that two of you were coming here. Where's the other detective?"

"I uh, can't find him. We separated to cover more ground and we organized a time and place to meet back up, but when I got there at that time, he wasn't there. I waited for a while, but he didn't show up, so I decided to come here."

"I see."

Jaune had finally reached the top of the table. Here he could clearly see Ruby and Professor Goodwitch. He began yelling to get there attention.

"HEY! LOOK DOWN HERE! ON THE TABLE!"

"Huh?" Ruby perked up. "Did you hear something?"

"Actually yes, I did." Professor Goodwitch said as they both looked for the source of the sound. "It sounded like distant yelling, but I couldn't quite tell who it was or what they were saying."

Jaune continued yelling until they finally looked down at him...

However, the two giant girls didn't see him, despite looking right at him.

No matter how loudly Jaune yelled, his voice didn't properly reach their ears.

"Anyway, I'd like you to take this. Maybe it will help," Professor Goodwitch said before placing a sheet of paper on the table.

"A list of names?" Ruby asked.

"Those are the names of all of the students that are confirmed to have disappeared so far," Professor Goodwitch explained. "If you can find some kind of connection between them, perhaps it'll help you make some progress."

"Oh, got it. Thank you."

As Ruby reached down to grab the paper, Jaune realised this was his chance to get closer to her so she could hear him. Once again, Ruby took notice of the voice.

Finally, his fingers grew too weak to hold on and he began falling...

Starting into a full blown sprint, Ruby ran around the boot obstruction in her way, making her way to what looked like a giant log. But Nora was hot on her tail, fee-fi-fo-fumming towards the tiny bug girl. Lifting her foot up high, the red-head crashed it down at her, Ruby managing to barely dodge it. Another later stomp also missed her body, but pinned her cape in place. Ruby tried to pull her cape free, yanking as hard as she could. Nora simply watched, giggling to herself, before knocking her down. As her soon-to-be executioner raised her foot, Ruby could see the stains of all the other bugs Nora had crushed, but she could have sworn she saw a tiny tie dangling down as well.

Closing her eyes in anticipation for the sudden demise, Ruby listened to the whooshing sound of the plummeting foot, and felt the ground shake below her as it finally made impact. But surprisingly, she was still alive. Opening her eyes, she noticed that she was in the crevice of the sneaker sole, staying safe in the empty space.
The giant red-head rose her foot back up to see her latest victim, before standing stunned that, not only had it survived, but was now making a break for it. Before she could respond accordingly, Ruby made it to the worn out log and hid in safety.

Breathing a sigh of relief, and looking back out to the giant girl, Ruby began laughing in hysterics. "Wow, I almost died! Ha ha! M-my life was almost snuffed out, by a... ha ha, a shoe! And I escaped! I escaped death! Death can go straight to heck!"
Her victory, however, was interrupted when she felt a presence near. Looking back around, tears still in her eyes, she saw a...
11411111.title: Giant Red-Head

choices: “My name is Jaune.” / “My name is Ren.”
114111111.content:
Much to Ruby’s relief, she spotted another person and, unlike the red-headed girl that had just tried to crush her under her shoe, this person was the same size as the cloaked girl. The person walked over to Ruby, surprised to see another person that had been shrunk like them.

“Hello.” they greeted. They then told Ruby their name.
114111111.title: Minuscule Micro Mate

1141112.title: Weiss or Blake

choices: The giant girl is Nora, looking for bugs to squash.
The giant girl is Weiss, who’s just finished speaking to the principal.
The giant girl is Blake, reading as she’s walking.
The giant girl is someone else.
114112.content:
“Alright, Detective Ruby and her trusty partner Weiss have begun their mission!” Ruby announced enthusiastically. “What is their mission? Solve the case of the missing students at Beacon Academy! Go team!”

“Ruby, please...” Weiss sighed, rolling her eyes. “Try to take this at least a little bit seriously.”

“I know, Weiss, but it’s just so exciting! This is a special mission! We’ve been on missions before, but nothing as cool as this!”

“Well, I will admit, it is quite refreshing to have an interesting mission for once.”

As much as she hated to admit it, Weiss was pretty excited too, though she still acted professional and mature.

The two entered the school and Ruby told Weiss her plan.

“Okay Weiss, you go talk to the principal and I’ll start investigating. We’ll meet back here in about ten minutes.”

“Sounds good.” Weiss replies as she began walking towards the building.

“Alright, investigating the missing students. Mission: Start!” Ruby whispered.

As Ruby investigated, she didn’t find much of interest. She found a penny in the ground and nearly tripped over a tree root, but other than that, it was pretty uneventful.

However, just as she was getting bored of how dull the investigation was so far, she found something of interest. A shed that wasn’t on the map she had with her. She walked over to it and grabbed the handle of the door, turning it. However, as she walked in, she was blinded by a sudden flash of light. There was a loud ringing in her ears before she passed out.

Later, she woke up on the ground outside. Her vision was blurry and her ears were still slightly ringing. As she stood up, the ringing slowly stopped and her vision returned to normal... and what she saw shocked her.

The world around her was much, much larger than it should’ve been, or at least, that’s what it looked like to her. In reality, she had shrunk. How much? To the size of a bug. At her current size, even the blades of grass were larger than her!

Her tiny stature became even more terrifying when she heard and felt what seemed like an earthquake, but as it grew closer, she realised it wasn’t an earthquake. It was giant footsteps.

She turned around and looked up, seeing a giant girl approaching her.
114112.title: Red and White

choices: Nora's shoe lands in front of it, blocking it off.
Ruby dived in, finally safe from Nora's wrath.
Your own idea (Because I'm too lazy to make a 3rd option here. Sorry. :P)
1141121.content:
These footsteps were gleeful, as if the person making them was cheerfully walking with a spring in their step.

Ruby saw a girl with orange hair approaching her. The size of this girl compared to her was unbelievable, not to mention terrifying. Ruby flinched as one of the girl's giant shoes landed fight in front of her, narrowly avoiding crushing her. The shoe alone was like a building compared to Ruby.

The girl above her had a mischievous grin on her face as her eyes scanned the ground, as if she were looking for something.

Ruby wondered what the giant girl would be looking for, but that question left her head as she saw movement. An ant had come running out of a hole in the ground and was now wandering around with seemingly no objective. Currently, Ruby was about the same size as the ant, maybe slightly bigger.

'I should probably stay away from it...' Ruby decided. I just hope it doesn't have a grudge against me for any of the times I might've accidentally squished its friends...'

However, while Ruby wanted to stay far away from it, the girl above had other ideas.

"Found one!" She exclaimed gleefully.

She quickly raised her shoe above the ant and just as quickly brought it down on the poor critter, crushing it instantly.

"Haha, gotcha!" The giant girl boasted.

She looked around and saw another ant nearby. She giggled playfully before lifting her other shoe up and stomping on that one too. To add insult to injury, she then began twisting her foot, grinding the ant's tiny body into the dirt.

"Ah, squishing you little guys is so much fun!" The giant girl exclaimed. "...Well, probably not as much fun for you." She chuckled.

Ruby watched in horror as this girl continued walking around and crushing every single bug and insect that she saw. However, the fear inside our tiny protagonist grew even worse when the giant girl's eyes locked onto her.

"How about you?" The girl asked. "You think you can take on the mighty Nora?"

Ruby didn't wait around any longer. She took off, running as fast as her now tiny legs could carry her. She could hear the giant footsteps following her as the girl, who Ruby now knew was named Nora, was undoubtedly chasing her. A giant shoe landed right next to Ruby, almost causing her to fall over, but she managed to keep her balance and continue running. She saw a hole in the trunk of a tree. With a goal now in mind, she pushed her legs to their absolute limits.

As she finally reached the hole...
1141121.title: Attack of the Giant Nora

choices: Continue trying to get Weiss' attention from the ground.
Try to find something on the ground to help get Weiss' attention.
1141122.content:
Ruby immediately recognised the girl as her partner. However, she was now much bigger. No, she was still the same size. She just looked bigger because Ruby was now the size of a bug. She immediately began calling out to her partner and waving her arms in an attempt to get her to notice the shrunken girl.

"HEY, WEISS! DOWN HERE! She screamed, as loud as possible.

However, her tiny voice failed to reach the giant heiress' ears.

"Ugh, where is she?" Weiss scoffed. "For someone so hyperactive, she always finds a way to be late."

Ruby continued yelling and waving her arms like a lunatic, but it still wasn't enough to get her partner's attention.

'I have to get her to notice me, but how?' Ruby wondered.

"I'll give her ten minutes," Weiss muttered. "If she's not here by then, I'll continue investigating without her."

Ruby panicked. She had ten minutes to come up with something. She had a few ideas. She could continue moving around on the ground in the hopes that Weiss would notice her movement and take a closer look. She could look around for something to use to get Weiss' attention, perhaps something to wave around. Or... an idea that Ruby wasn't exactly fond of... She could climb up Weiss' body to her shoulder and yell into her ear. Surely she'd be able to hear Ruby's tiny voice then and notice her... right?

After a while, Ruby decided to...
1141122.title: Weiss returns.

choices: Investigate the place where she shrunk.
Try to find someone to help.
11411221.content:
Ruby decided her best option would be to continue doing what she was doing before. She couldn't afford to waste time finding something to help her and climbing Weiss' body would be too dangerous... not to mention embarrassing... Ruby ran right towards Weiss and stood in front of her shoe, jumping repeatedly, waving her arms and shouting up to her partner.

"HEY WEISS! DOWN HERE ON THE GROUND! LOOK DOWN HERE!"

Surely, Weiss would have to look down eventually, then she would see Ruby and save her... right? Ruby began to wonder if this was indeed what would happen if she continued, but pushed that thought out of her head. She didn't have time to stop and think about whether or not this would work. All she could do was hope for the best.

That hope seemed to pull through as she noticed Weiss' blue eyes trail down to the ground. Ruby began making even more dramatic motions than before.

'Come on, Weiss!' Ruby begged. 'Surely you can't possibly miss this!'

She was definitely correct. Weiss didn't miss her motions. Her eyes narrowed on the tiny, moving speck on the ground right in front of her foot. Ruby could tell by the giant heiress' expression that she could see her. However, she didn't realise that this wasn't exactly a good thing...

"Oh gross, a bug!" Weiss exclaimed, raising her foot above the speck on the ground.

"Wait, Weiss! No, I'm not a- AAAHHH!"

Ruby attempted to call to her partner, only to scream as Weiss' shoe smashed the ground near her.

"Go away, you disgusting little pest!" Weiss ordered the "bug".

Of course, she didn't expect it to understand her and leave her alone, but one can dream, right?

Ruby was about to try yelling up to her partner again, but was forced to dodge another incoming shoe, the shockwave sending her flying. She landed on the ground painfully, but shook off the pain as she got back up.

'It's no use, I can't get through to her!' Ruby realised. 'For now, I'll just have to run!'

Ruby began sprinting away from Weiss as fast as she could. At first, the giant heiress continued stomping, attempting to crush the "bug" under her shoe, but as she saw that it was finally running away, she stopped, satisfied.

"Hmph, you'd better run," Weiss muttered before sighing. "And of course, Ruby's still not back."

Ruby continued running until she was certain she was too far away for Weiss to spot her. She didn't know what she felt more of; exhaustion or despair.

'Weiss didn't recognise me...' Ruby thought sadly. 'My own partner... She mistook me for a bug and... Tried to squish me under her foot...'

This was all so crazy. She'd spent a long time waiting for a special mission, and now that she'd finally gotten one, she was shrunken down to the size of a bug and almost crushed underfoot by her own partner. This was too crazy for her. Too surreal. She was tempted to give up.

'...No, snap out of it, Ruby!' the tiny detective thought, determination visible in her eyes. 'You wanted a special mission, something new and bizarre, now you've got it! The least you can do is see it through to the end or die trying!'

She slapped herself in the face a couple of times, psyching herself up.

'I CAN DO THIS! THIS IS WHERE I EITHER LIVE A HERO OR DIE A HERO! ...Hopefully live, I don't wanna die... BUT EITHER WAY, I WILL BE A HERO!'

And thus, Ruby began her journey. She decided on her next course of action...
11411221.title: The Heiress and the Bug

1141124.title: The giant girl is someone else.

And just as well, it goes well with my eyes." She looked over at her partner, who looked annoyed. "I must be talking your fuzzy little ears off...

The first person we’ll start our story with is:
131.title: Starting Off

info.brief_description: The cast of RWBY and the scenario of Shrink High merge together
info.description:
Here are the basic ground rules, you can either play the entire story the same way as Shrink High does, or you can throw in your own story. As stated, the characters of Shrink High will be replace with characters of RWBY, like Narue would be replace by Ruby. Up to you on whose who.

Other than that, here are some rules I prefer to keep no matter what.

1) The shrunken characters has to be 1/4 of an inch. You can get smaller than that, go wild on the shrinking scale, but unless a female is also growing as well, the shrunken character will not grow any bigger than 1/4 of an inch.

2) I don't mind most things that involves 18+ stuff, just no disgusting things like scat, or poop, and no worshiping of any kind.

3) Please use proper grammar and no sentences shorter than five words.

Other than that, go nuts.
